pull_request.title: [Regression] - Fixing Docker setup regression in `yarn install` command
pull_request.body:
## Overview
<!--
READ ME FIRST:
Please answer *both* questions below and check off every point from the Essential Checklist!
If there is no corresponding issue number, fill in N/A where it says [fill_in_number_here] below in 1.
-->

1. This PR fixes or fixes part of #[fill_in_number_here].
2. This PR does the following: Due to recent changes in the `mathjs v12` package (https://github.com/josdejong/mathjs/pull/3079), the `yarn install` step in docker setup was failing for all the developers. The reason was that we earlier missed the `pure-lockfile` flag with the `yarn install` command in the Dockerfile. This is the PR which fixes the regression in the docker setup and the Docker Action which is blocking all the PRs right now due to the issue

issue.title: [BUG]: Learner dashboard is non-responsive and not properly aligned

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Label to indicate an issue is a regression

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

The Learner Dashboard is currently experiencing issues related to responsiveness and alignment, reporting that the dashboard does not display correctly (non-responsive) on specific devices, such as the iPad Air and similar devices. Additionally, the alignment of story cards appear to be misaligned.

### URL of the page where the issue is observed.

https://www.oppia.org/learner-dashboard

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Access the Learner Dashboard using an iPad Air or a device with a similar screen size else try browser dev tools.
2. Observe that the dashboard is not properly responsive and appears broken in the middle of the display.
3. Notice that the story cards and left menu are not aligned properly, affecting the overall user experience.
4. 


### Expected Behavior

The Learner Dashboard should be responsive and display correctly on a variety of devices, including the iPad Air. The story cards should be aligned neatly and consistently.



### Screenshots/Videos

![Screenshot 2023-10-27 at 10 37 04 AM](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/108923011/b4a679ad-ff93-434e-9377-f232d2a1ae30)


### What device are you using?

Desktop

### Operating System

MacOS

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### Browser version

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Tips for developers

Before tackling the bug, please use `git bisect` (see https://git-scm.com/docs/git-bisect) to investigate which PR caused it (you only need to go back as far as commit https://github.com/oppia/oppia/commits/9a334e9). If you find the PR, leave a comment on this issue pointing to it, or just say that it happened before commit 9a334e9 if you could reproduce it there. This will help us fix the issue by reverting the faulty PR.

Also, if this is your first issue, please make sure to follow https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#choosing-a-good-first-issue and https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#setting-things-up before claiming it. Thanks!

Adding a class to the a tag and targeting it in the contact page (oppia/core/templates/pages/contact-page/contact-page.component.html) ``` "I18N_CONTACT_PAGE_OTHER_INQUIRIES_PARAGRAPH_1": "For general questions, please reach out to [admin@oppia.org](mailto:admin@oppia.org)." ``` And I targeted this class in the contact-page.component.html: ``` .oppia-contact-mail{ text-decoration: underline; } ``` This is also not working. As seen from the inspect page, the class is applied to the a tag but the style does not apply. this is the devtools ss for all above 3 cases: ![Screenshot from 2023-10-27 10-23-58](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/ca55f7b6-0b90-4445-816e-88af45493ca4) In addition the tag has a style form third_party.css to make text-underline as none, that I can override if the class is targeted in oppia.css. For conclusion the only way it is working is targeting the class in the oppia.css See this screenshot the style is getting applied on if i put it in oppia.css ![Screenshot from 2023-10-27 10-25-41](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/96219910/8c7850bd-3549-4a09-8b57-43675bd172a8)
